node.title: Novak Djokovic has Australian visa cancelled for second time
node.description: The 34-year-old's time in Australia has been turbulent since his arrival last week.
node.content: ["Novak Djokovic's visa has been cancelled for a second time, courtesy of Australian immigration minister Alex Hawke.", "In a statement released on Friday night, minister Hawke confirmed Djokvic's visa had been cancelled again, after the original cancellation was overturned on Monday.", "\"Today I exercised my power under section 133C(3) of the Migration Act to cancel the visa held by Mr Novak Djokovic on health and good order grounds, on the basis that it was in the public interest to do so,\" Hawke says.", "The world No.1's time in Australia has been turbulent after he was detained at the border last week shortly after his arrival in Melbourne.", "Djokovic arrived in Australia under the assumption he had a medical exemption from being vaccinated against COVID-19, a prerequisite for all players competing in this month's Australian Open.", "The 20-time Grand Slam winner was detained in an Australian immigration detention hotel before the decision to cancel Djokovic's visa was overturned on Monday.", "More to come."]
